page.title: 13NETHERHALL FARM AND HALL
page.content: Close to Dobbs Weir and Lea Valley Park is{Nether Hall}ruins. The restored and maintained farmhouse is a grade 2 listed building. Part is medieval and the rest 14th. century. The owners breed and race greyhounds and the old cattle sheds house 27 dogs. Around the beautiful farmhouse exercise pens have been built. Close by is a 13th. century barn. The owners in conjunction with Epping Forest Council and Lea Valley Regional Park Authority hope to restore and make the barn open to the public. In the farm's grounds lies Nether Hall ruin. This 15th. century building has been partly destroyed. Its brick lined moat still exists and is home to many water birds including moorhens, coots and kingfishers.
